title: maxirosson
author: maxirosson
content: I created a website (https://thebitcoinhole.com/) where I compare more than 30 different hardware wallets. I want to have the most complete and accurate website. The goal is to help you to choose which wallet to buy. So, I am offering 1000 sats to each person that finds an error on the website.You can read all the details about the bounty here:https://twitter.com/thebitcoinhole/status/1669095352165715969

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Why limit bug reporting to Twitter? Considering that you're promoting your website on the bitcointalk forum, wouldn't it be fair to provide everyone with the opportunity to report bugs? After all, not everyone uses Twitter.

comments.author: maxirosson
comments.body: Yes, you are right. You can also report here. No problem with that.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: maxirosson on June 14, 2023, 10:13:26 PMSo, I am offering 1000 sats to each person that finds an error on the website.Very nice initiative, and maybe it could help getting more attention if you tag all accounts from hardware wallets listed on your website.I am not hunting for 1000 sats, and I think that I already reported most of the things that should be corrected (based on my own research).PSSince you added third party bitcoin wallets (Sparrow, Specter etc), maybe you can add one more called Lily wallet.It is open source wallet and it works with hardware wallets and in multisig setups:https://github.com/Lily-Technologies/lily-wallethttps://lily-wallet.com/
